ingredients.name: Charred Skeever Hide
ingredients.location: Charred Skeever hides are collected from Skeevers roasting over a fire, commonly in bandit or giant camps. You cannot create Charred Skeever Hides yourself. See Tolvald's Cave, northeast of Shor's Stone, or Alftand, southeast of Winterhold, for of Charred Skeever Hides.

ingredients.name: Felsaad Tern Feathers
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Felsaad Tern Feathers are feathers found on Felsaad Tern birds. The birds are likely to drop one to three feathers, and can be found anywhere in Solstheim but especially along Felsaad Coast. There are also feathers in Caerellius House in the Raven Rock docks and downstairs of Ienth Farm in Raven Rock.

ingredients.name: Hawk Feathers
ingredients.location: Hawk Feathers are dropped by Hawks, of which there is a large collection near the East Empire Company Warehouse outside of Solitude, and more just northeast of Solitude. There's also an individual Hawk Beak in Alftand, southeast of Winterhold, and Silver Hand members have a high chance of carrying them as well.

ingredients.name: Mudcrab Chitin
ingredients.location: Mudcrab Chitin are the claws of Mudcrabs and can be salvaged from their bodies. Mudcrabs can be found along riverbanks and lakeshores, and individual samples of Mudcrab Chitin can be found in Pale Imperial Camp, west of Dawnstar, and Riverside Shack, southwest of Windhelm.

ingredients.name: Vampire Dust
ingredients.location: Vampire Dust is a dark grey substance inside a wooden bowl. They're always dropped by Vampires, which can be found in dark lairs and caves all around Skyrim, and sometimes in the wilderness as well. Nightcaller Temple outside of Dawnstar has a few samples of Vampire Dust, as do both The Mortar and Pestle shop inside of Dawnstar itself and Honeyside in Riften.

ingredients.name: Crimson Nirnroot
ingredients.location: Crimson Nirnroot is a special type of Nirnroot found exclusively in Blackreach. Like normal Nirnroots, the crimson variant is usually found near water and makes a chiming sound when you get near it.

ingredients.name: Deathbell
ingredients.location: Deathbells are large blue-colored flowers. They are commonly found in swampy areas, such as Hjaalmarch, with a large number of them in the Forelhost Refectory in the Forelhost ruin southest of Riften.

ingredients.name: Ectoplasm
ingredients.location: Ectoplasm are wooden bowls with grey-green contents. They're dropped by ghosts and other etheral undead, which can be found in various dungeons. There are also several samples of Ectoplasm in the Hall of Countenance in the College of Winterhold and in The Mortar and Pestle shop in Dawnstar.

ingredients.name: Emperor Parasol Moss
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Emperor Parasol Moss are plants growing from Emperor Parasol mushrooms. The mushrooms can be found near Tel Mithryn in southeastern Solstheim.

ingredients.name: Falmer Ear
ingredients.location: Falmer Ears are the actual ears of Falmers, and can be found on their bodies. Falmers can be found in underground lairs, often near Dwarven ruins. There are also a whole bunch of ears in the Alftand ruins, southwest of Winterhold, and in Forelhost, southeast of Riften.

ingredients.name: Human Flesh
ingredients.location: As the name describes, Human Flesh is chunks of meat off a human body and looks a lot like raw beef. Unfortunately, the ingredient cannot be looted from humans, but are found in necromancer dungeons and in locations where people have performed the black sacrement ritual to summon the Dark Brotherhood. There's a large collection of Human Flesh in Castle Volkihar (Dawnguard only); otherwise, look in Alftand, southeast of Winterhold, or Tolvald's Cave, northeast of Shor's Stone.

ingredients.name: Human Heart
ingredients.location: Human Hearts cannot be looted off dead humans, but are instead found where in locations where people have performed the black sacrement ritual to summon the Dark Brotherhood. Samples exist in the Aretino Residence in Windhelm, Black-Briar Manor in Riften, and Volunruud, southeast of Morthal

ingredients.name: Imp Stool
ingredients.location: Imp Stool are round mushrooms with yellowish caps, which are commonly found in caves. The largest source of Imp Stool is Chillwind Depths, a mountain cavern on the border of Hjaalmarch and The Reach.

ingredients.name: Nightshade
ingredients.location: Nightshade are purple flowers that normally grow around graveyards. Samples can be collected in Solitude, the Hall of the Dead in Falkreath and in Labyrinthian, a ruin southeast of Morthal.

ingredients.name: Nirnroot
ingredients.location: Nirnroot is a plant that glows in the dark and makes a chiming sound when you get near them. They're usually found near water, or at Sarethi Farm between Riften and Ivarstead, where they are being cultivated.

ingredients.name: Poison Bloom
ingredients.location: Added in the Dawnguard DLC, Poison Bloom is a purple flower which can only be found in Darkfall Cave, north of Markarth. If not immediately picked, it will release a poisonous gas when someone is near.

ingredients.name: Red Mountain Flower
ingredients.location: Red Mountain Flowers are, as the name suggests, red flowers. They look the same as blue and purple mountain flowers, and can be found in large droves in the foothills and below the snowline in the mountains. A lot of Red Mountain Flowers can be found in Shadowgreen Cavern, north-northwest of Solitude. They are also frequently sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: River Betty
ingredients.location: River Betty is a purple fish that can be caught in lakes, ponds and rivers (despite the name, they're no more commonly found in rivers than any other fish). They're more commonly found in shallow water: a good spot to find them is in the water around The Apprentice Stone, west-northwest of Morthal. River Betty can also be found in fish barrels or sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Skeever Tail
ingredients.location: Skeever Tails are dropped by Skeevers, and can also be found in any spider web sac that contains a Skeever. Skeevers are rat-like animals that can be found in caves and dungeons, as well as in the Skyrim wilderness. Additionally, a large cache of Skeever Tails can be found in the Commander's Quarters in Fort Dunstad, south of Dawnstar, as well as the Basement of Honningbrew Meadery just outside of Whiterun.

ingredients.name: Small Antlers
ingredients.location: Small Antlers are antlers dropped by female Elk, while males drop Large Antlers instead. Elks can be found around the Skyrim wilderness, and have a 50/50 chance of dropping antlers when killed. Peddlers sometimes carry antlers as well, and a couple of samples of Small Antlers can be found in Rimerock Burrow, northwest of Dragon Bridge.

ingredients.name: Troll Fat
ingredients.location: Troll Fat are wooden bowls with white contents. They are dropped by trolls, which can be found everywhere in the Skyrim wilderness. Another fantastic source of Troll Fat is the East Empire Company Warehouse on the Solitude docks.

ingredients.name: Void Salts
ingredients.location: Void Salts are a wooden bowl with dark grey contents, and are typically dropped by Storm Atronachs and Storm Thralls. Unfortunately, summoned atronachs don't drop any salts, and finding non-summoned Storm Atronachs can be tricky. The Blue Palace in Solitude, Angeline's Aromatics shop in Solitude, and Proudspire Manor in Solitude (if you've bought it) will have samples of Void Salts as well.

ingredients.name: Butterfly Wing
ingredients.location: Blue Butterfly Wings can be harvested by catching orange monarch butterflies. Butterflies can be found during the day in non-snowy areas. A large collection of butterflies exists near Talking Stone Giant Camp, northeast of Rorikstead along the Hjaal river.

ingredients.name: Chaurus Eggs
ingredients.location: Charus Eggs can be found in Falmer hives, and they are also dropped by Chaurus and Chaurus Reapers. They are round and glow with a pale blue light, making them easy to spot even in caves. Frostflow Lighthouse, west of Winterhold, has a huge number of Chaurus Eggs.

ingredients.name: Daedra Heart
ingredients.location: Daedra Hearts are dropped by slain Dremora. In addition to alchemical uses, they're also used to make Daedric armor and weapons. Dremora are rare in Skyrim, but can be found in the Shrine of Mehrunes Dagon, Shalidor's Maze and Azura's Star Interior. They're sometimes sold by alchemy vendors, and almost always by Enthir at the College of Winterhold.

ingredients.name: Eye of Sabre Cat
ingredients.location: Eyes of Sabre Cats are sometimes dropped by Sabre Cats instead of teeth. Sabre Cats can be found everywhere in the Skyrim wilderness, and occasionally samples of their eyes can be found on peddlers and Forsworn. A couple of eyes can also be found near Karthspire Camp, east of Morthal.

ingredients.name: Glow Dust
ingredients.location: Glow Dust is easy to identify as wooden bowls with glowing contents. They are dropped by Wisps and Wispmothers, which are typically found in non-snowy wilderness. There are also samples of Glow Dust in the Shrine of Mehrunes Dagon, southeast of Morthal, or in Proudspire Manor in Solitude (if you've bought it).

ingredients.name: Hagraven Feathers
ingredients.location: Unlike their claws, Hagraven Feathers are always dropped by Hagravens. Hagravens can often be found in the company of Forsworn, or inside of groves and lairs in the wilderness. Samples of Hagraven Feathers can be found in Hag's End, which is accessible through Deepwood Redoubt west of Solitude, as well as Witchmist Grove, south of Windhelm.

ingredients.name: Hanging Moss
ingredients.location: Hanging Moss is a green-brown plant often found hanging off rocky ledges, trees or dungeon ceilings. It can be found everywhere in Skyrim, but seems to be more frequent in The Reach. The Solitude Catacombs, Dustman's Cairn, northwest of Whiterun, and Kolskeggr Mine, east of Markarth, all have large collections of Hanging Moss.

ingredients.name: Human Heart
ingredients.location: Human Hearts cannot be looted off dead humans, but are instead found where in locations where people have performed the black sacrement ritual to summon the Dark Brotherhood. Samples exist in the Aretino Residence in Windhelm, Black-Briar Manor in Riften, and Volunruud, southeast of Morthal

ingredients.name: Luna Moth Wing
ingredients.location: Luna Moth Wings can be collected by Luna Moths, which are easy to spot thanks to their glowing wings. Unlike other butterflies, Luna Moths only come out at night, and there is a lot of them around Talking Stone Camp, northeast of Rorikstead as well as inside Bloated Man's Grotto, north of Falkreath.

ingredients.name: Namira's Rot
ingredients.location: Namira's Rot are mushrooms with brownish caps, which are commonly found on cave floors. The largest source of Namira's Rot is Chillwind Depths, a mountain cavern on the border of Hjaalmarch and The Reach.

ingredients.name: Nordic Barnacle
ingredients.location: Nordic Barnacle are found in nordic barnacle clusters, which are only found underwater. A good spot to find them is Hela's Folly, a shipwreck northeast of Dawnstar.

ingredients.name: Trama Root
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Trama Root are dead-looking roots that can be harvested from spikey-looking plants growing in the ash-covered parts of Solstheim. There are a bunch of Trama Roots in Severin Manor in Raven Rock as well.

ingredients.name: Ancestor Moth Wing
ingredients.location: Added in the Dawnguard DLC, Ancestor Moth Wings are wings that can be harvested from Ancestor Moths. These moths can be only found in Ancestor Glade, east of Falkreath along the southern border of Skyrim. Ancestor Moths cannot be harvested for their wings while they are flying, only when they have landed.

ingredients.name: Bear Claws
ingredients.location: Bear claws are dropped by killed bears, which can be found in the Skryim wilderness or cave lairs.

ingredients.name: Blue Butterfly Wing
ingredients.location: Blue Butterfly Wings can be harvested by catching blue butterflies. Butterflies can be found during the day in non-snowy areas. A large collection of butterflies exists near Talking Stone Giant Camp, northeast of Rorikstead along the Hjaal river.

ingredients.name: Blue Mountain Flower
ingredients.location: Blue Mountain Flowers are, as the name suggests, blue flowers. They look the same as purple and red mountain flowers, and can be found in large droves in the foothills and below the snowline in the mountains. A large collection of Blue Mountain Flowers can be found near Sleeping Tree Camp, southeast of Rorikstead, and they are frequently sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Burnt Spriggan Wood
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Burnt Spriggan Wood are dropped by Burnt Spriggans. These creatures can be found in the ashlands of southern Solstheim.

ingredients.name: Chaurus Hunter Antennae
ingredients.location: Added in the Dawnguard DLC, Chaurus Hunter Antennae are dropped by Chaurus Hunters and Chaurus Hunter Fledglings. These insect-like creatures can, like normal Chaurus, be found in caves and dungeons all over Skyrim.

ingredients.name: Chicken's Egg
ingredients.location: Chicken's Eggs can be found in chicken nests around farms. Nests are usually under a low sloping roof, but can sometimes just be found on the ground. There's a large number of Chicken's Eggs in the Thalmor Embassy in Haafingar.

ingredients.name: Glow Dust
ingredients.location: Glow Dust is easy to identify as wooden bowls with glowing contents. They are dropped by Wisps and Wispmothers, which are typically found in non-snowy wilderness. There are also samples of Glow Dust in the Shrine of Mehrunes Dagon, southeast of Morthal, or in Proudspire Manor in Solitude (if you've bought it).

ingredients.name: Hanging Moss
ingredients.location: Hanging Moss is a green-brown plant often found hanging off rocky ledges, trees or dungeon ceilings. It can be found everywhere in Skyrim, but seems to be more frequent in The Reach. The Solitude Catacombs, Dustman's Cairn, northwest of Whiterun, and Kolskeggr Mine, east of Markarth, all have large collections of Hanging Moss.

ingredients.name: Hawk's Egg
ingredients.location: Added in the Hearthfire DLC, Hawk's Eggs are white eggs that can be found in hawk nests. Such nests can be found on the roof of Heljarchen Hall and Lakeview Manor.

ingredients.name: Human Heart
ingredients.location: Human Hearts cannot be looted off dead humans, but are instead found where in locations where people have performed the black sacrement ritual to summon the Dark Brotherhood. Samples exist in the Aretino Residence in Windhelm, Black-Briar Manor in Riften, and Volunruud, southeast of Morthal

ingredients.name: Nightshade
ingredients.location: Nightshade are purple flowers that normally grow around graveyards. Samples can be collected in Solitude, the Hall of the Dead in Falkreath and in Labyrinthian, a ruin southeast of Morthal.

ingredients.name: Spider Egg
ingredients.location: Spider Eggs are yellow-green eggs that can be harvested from egg and web sacs of Frostbite Spiders. Spiders are generally found in dungeons, where eggs are more likely to appear, but can also spawn in the wilderness. There's a lot of Spider Eggs in Harmugstahl, northeast of Markarth, and in Ironbind Barrow, inbetween Winterhold and Whiterun.

ingredients.name: Spriggan Sap
ingredients.location: Spriggan Sap is a green-blue substance in a small ceramic bowl. It can unfortunately not be harvested from Spriggans, which drop Taproots instead. Multiple samples of Spriggan Sap can be found in Proudspire Manor in Solitude, Honeyside in Riften, and the Hall of Countenance in the College of Winterhold.

ingredients.name: Ancestor Moth Wing
ingredients.location: Added in the Dawnguard DLC, Ancestor Moth Wings are wings that can be harvested from Ancestor Moths. These moths can be only found in Ancestor Glade, east of Falkreath along the southern border of Skyrim. Ancestor Moths cannot be harvested for their wings while they are flying, only when they have landed.

ingredients.name: Ash Creep Cluster
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Ash Creep Cluster is a yellow cluster similar in appearance (but not color) to the normal Creep Cluster. They can be found exclusively in Solstheim. There's one right outside of Bloodskal Barrow, accessible from Raven Rock Mine, and another one in Raven Rock Mine itself.

ingredients.name: Blisterwort
ingredients.location: Blisterwort are red-capped mushrooms commonly found in caves. The largest source of Blisterwort is Chillwind Depths, a mountain cavern on the border of Hjaalmarch and The Reach.

ingredients.name: Blue Butterfly Wing
ingredients.location: Blue Butterfly Wings can be harvested by catching blue butterflies. Butterflies can be found during the day in non-snowy areas. A large collection of butterflies exists near Talking Stone Giant Camp, northeast of Rorikstead along the Hjaal river.

ingredients.name: Bone Meal
ingredients.location: Bone Meal is dropped by undead, such as skeletons and draugr, both of which may drop a sample. They're always dropped by Dragon Priests and are frequently sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Canis Root
ingredients.location: Canis Root is harvested from small gnarled bushes. They are usually found near near rock formations or the base of cliffs in the Rift, or in swampy regions in Hjaalmarch. The largest collection of Canis Roots can be found around Folgunthur, east of Solitude, or Pinepeak Cavern, north of Ivarstead.

ingredients.name: Chaurus Hunter Antennae
ingredients.location: Added in the Dawnguard DLC, Chaurus Hunter Antennae are dropped by Chaurus Hunters and Chaurus Hunter Fledglings. These insect-like creatures can, like normal Chaurus, be found in caves and dungeons all over Skyrim.

ingredients.name: Crimson Nirnroot
ingredients.location: Crimson Nirnroot is a special type of Nirnroot found exclusively in Blackreach. Like normal Nirnroots, the crimson variant is usually found near water and makes a chiming sound when you get near it.

ingredients.name: Cyrodilic Spadetail
ingredients.location: Cyrodilic Spadetail is a red fish that can be caught in lakes, ponds and rivers. They're more commonly found in shallow water: a good spot to find them is in the water around The Apprentice Stone, west-northwest of Morthal. Cyrodilic Spadetail can also be found in fish barrels or sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Giant's Toe
ingredients.location: Giant's Toes are appendages dropped by all varieities of Giants. The best place to look for Giants are their camps, which are scattered around Skyrim. Giants can also be found individually or in groups around the wilderness, sometimes herding Mammoths. Samples of Giant's Toes can be found in The White Hall in Dawnstar, or in the East Empire Company Warehouse outside of Solitude.

ingredients.name: Nirnroot
ingredients.location: Nirnroot is a plant that glows in the dark and makes a chiming sound when you get near them. They're usually found near water, or at Sarethi Farm between Riften and Ivarstead, where they are being cultivated.

ingredients.name: Rock Warbler Egg
ingredients.location: Rock Warbler Eggs are green eggs found in bird nests. Both Rock Warbler Eggs and Pine Thrush Eggs come from similar-looking nests, but Rock Warbler Eggs are more common in rocky areas. A particularly good spot for Rock Warbler Eggs are the area around Valthume, southeast of Markarth.

ingredients.name: Spider Egg
ingredients.location: Spider Eggs are yellow-green eggs that can be harvested from egg and web sacs of Frostbite Spiders. Spiders are generally found in dungeons, where eggs are more likely to appear, but can also spawn in the wilderness. There's a lot of Spider Eggs in Harmugstahl, northeast of Markarth, and in Ironbind Barrow, inbetween Winterhold and Whiterun.

ingredients.name: Creep Cluster
ingredients.location: Creep Cluster are harvested from orange-colored roots growing on rocks. They're generally only found in Eastmarch, with a large collection found near Steamcrag Camp, south of Windhelm.

ingredients.name: Daedra Heart
ingredients.location: Daedra Hearts are dropped by slain Dremora. In addition to alchemical uses, they're also used to make Daedric armor and weapons. Dremora are rare in Skyrim, but can be found in the Shrine of Mehrunes Dagon, Shalidor's Maze and Azura's Star Interior. They're sometimes sold by alchemy vendors, and almost always by Enthir at the College of Winterhold.

ingredients.name: Frost Mirriam
ingredients.location: Frost Mirriam are dried plants found hanging in houses, often near garlic and elves ears. A couple of good examples of Frost Mirriam sources are Black-Briar Lodge east of Riften, Vlindrel Hall in Markarth and Burguk's Longhouse in Dushnikh Yal, east of Markarth.

ingredients.name: Giant's Toe
ingredients.location: Giant's Toes are appendages dropped by all varieities of Giants. The best place to look for Giants are their camps, which are scattered around Skyrim. Giants can also be found individually or in groups around the wilderness, sometimes herding Mammoths. Samples of Giant's Toes can be found in The White Hall in Dawnstar, or in the East Empire Company Warehouse outside of Solitude.

ingredients.name: Histcarp
ingredients.location: Histcarp is a orange-colored fish that can be caught in lakes, ponds and rivers. A good spot to find them is in the water around The Apprentice Stone, west-northwest of Morthal. Histcarp can also be found in fish barrels or sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Juniper Berries
ingredients.location: Juniper Berries are small white berries that can be harvested from a tree-like bush that grow in The Reach. The surroundings around Dushnikh Yal and Valthume, southeast of Markarth, have a large density of Juniper Berries.

ingredients.name: Large Antlers
ingredients.location: Large Antlers are antlers dropped by male Deer, Elk or White Stag; females drop Small Antlers instead. Each of the animals can be found around the Skyrim wilderness, and have a 50/50 chance of dropping antlers when killed. Peddlers sometimes carry antlers as well; Vaermina Devotees in Nightcaller Temple have a very small chance of dropping them as well.

ingredients.name: Silverside Perch
ingredients.location: Silverside Perch is a silvery fish that can be caught in lakes, ponds and rivers. They're more commonly found in shallow water: a good spot to find them is in the water around The Apprentice Stone, west-northwest of Morthal. Silverside Perch can also be found in fish barrels or sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Skeever Tail
ingredients.location: Skeever Tails are dropped by Skeevers, and can also be found in any spider web sac that contains a Skeever. Skeevers are rat-like animals that can be found in caves and dungeons, as well as in the Skyrim wilderness. Additionally, a large cache of Skeever Tails can be found in the Commander's Quarters in Fort Dunstad, south of Dawnstar, as well as the Basement of Honningbrew Meadery just outside of Whiterun.

ingredients.name: Wheat
ingredients.location: Wheat are identified as large yellow bales. They're very common on farms, with large collections outside of Cowflop Farmhouse in Rorikstead and Hollyfrost Farm, east of Windhelm. They're also frequently sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Yellow Mountain Flower
ingredients.location: Added in the Dawnguard DLC, Yellow Mountain Flower look the same as blue, purple and red mountain flowers, but with yellow flowers instead. A really good spot for Yellow Mountain Flowers is in Ancestor Glade, east of Falkreath.

ingredients.name: Blue Dartwing
ingredients.location: Blue Dartwings can be harvested by catching blue dragonflies. Dragonflies are normally found near water during the day. A large collection of dragonflies exists near The Apprentice Stone, on a island in the march west-northwest of Morthal.

ingredients.name: Cyrodilic Spadetail
ingredients.location: Cyrodilic Spadetail is a red fish that can be caught in lakes, ponds and rivers. They're more commonly found in shallow water: a good spot to find them is in the water around The Apprentice Stone, west-northwest of Morthal. Cyrodilic Spadetail can also be found in fish barrels or sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Daedra Heart
ingredients.location: Daedra Hearts are dropped by slain Dremora. In addition to alchemical uses, they're also used to make Daedric armor and weapons. Dremora are rare in Skyrim, but can be found in the Shrine of Mehrunes Dagon, Shalidor's Maze and Azura's Star Interior. They're sometimes sold by alchemy vendors, and almost always by Enthir at the College of Winterhold.

ingredients.name: Gleamblossom
ingredients.location: Added in the Dawnguard DLC, Gleamblossom is a purple and blue flower. They can be found in caves and other dark places; there are especially large collection of Gleamblossom in Darkfall Passage and Forgotten Vale, both of which can be accessed through Darkfall Cave, north of Markarth.

ingredients.name: Namira's Rot
ingredients.location: Namira's Rot are mushrooms with brownish caps, which are commonly found on cave floors. The largest source of Namira's Rot is Chillwind Depths, a mountain cavern on the border of Hjaalmarch and The Reach.

ingredients.name: Netch Jelly
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Netch Jelly is a bluish substance inside a stone bowl. It is dropped by Netch, jellyfish-like creatures that can be found in groups of three to five near water in the southern regions of Solstheim. There are a couple of samples of jelly in Raven Rock Mine as well.

ingredients.name: Poison Bloom
ingredients.location: Added in the Dawnguard DLC, Poison Bloom is a purple flower which can only be found in Darkfall Cave, north of Markarth. If not immediately picked, it will release a poisonous gas when someone is near.

ingredients.name: Powdered Mammoth Tusk
ingredients.location: Powdered Mammoth Tusks are bowls with yellowish contents. They can only be looted, and not made from mammoth tusks. Powdered Mammoth Tusks are very rare and there are no guaranteed samples; the best bet is finding peddlers randomly in the wilderness, in Apothecary's Satchels or dropped by Forsworn.

ingredients.name: Burnt Spriggan Wood
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Burnt Spriggan Wood are dropped by Burnt Spriggans. These creatures can be found in the ashlands of southern Solstheim.

ingredients.name: Grass Pod
ingredients.location: Grass Pods are whitish oval pods that can be harvested from grass plants. These plants normally grow along Skyrim's northern coasts and along the rivers around Morthal. Areas particularly dense with Grass Pods are around Ravenscar Hollow, northwest of Solitude, as well as the Wreck Of The Brinehammer, west of Dawnstar.

ingredients.name: River Betty
ingredients.location: River Betty is a purple fish that can be caught in lakes, ponds and rivers (despite the name, they're no more commonly found in rivers than any other fish). They're more commonly found in shallow water: a good spot to find them is in the water around The Apprentice Stone, west-northwest of Morthal. River Betty can also be found in fish barrels or sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Spriggan Sap
ingredients.location: Spriggan Sap is a green-blue substance in a small ceramic bowl. It can unfortunately not be harvested from Spriggans, which drop Taproots instead. Multiple samples of Spriggan Sap can be found in Proudspire Manor in Solitude, Honeyside in Riften, and the Hall of Countenance in the College of Winterhold.

ingredients.name: Butterfly Wing
ingredients.location: Blue Butterfly Wings can be harvested by catching orange monarch butterflies. Butterflies can be found during the day in non-snowy areas. A large collection of butterflies exists near Talking Stone Giant Camp, northeast of Rorikstead along the Hjaal river.

ingredients.name: Dragon's Tongue
ingredients.location: Dragon's Tongue is a yellow flower. They are usually found in Eastmarch, with large collections around Steamcrag Camp, Witchmist Grove and Bonestrewn Crest, all of which can be found in close to each other south of Windhelm.

ingredients.name: Hagraven Claw
ingredients.location: Hagraven Claws are sometimes dropped by Hagravens, unlike their feathers which always drop. Hagravens can often be found in the company of Forsworn, or inside of groves and lairs in the wilderness. Samples of Hagraven Claws can be found in Grave Concoctions in Falkreath, Hall of Countenance at the College of Winterhold or The White Hall in Dawnstar.

ingredients.name: Tundra Cotton
ingredients.location: Tundra Cotton is a very common plant which has large white flowers that almost look like cotton balls (hence the name). The plant is very common in Whiterun Hold, with lots of samples available near Broken Fang Cave, west of Whiterun and Whitewatch Tower, northeast of Whiterun.

ingredients.name: Bleeding Crown
ingredients.location: Bleeding Crown are mushrooms with red/purple caps, which are commonly found in caves. The largest source of Bleeding Crown is Chillwind Depths, a mountain cavern on the border of Hjaalmarch and The Reach.

ingredients.name: Boar Tusk
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Boar Tusks are long tusks dropped by Bristlebacks and the Rieklings that ride them. There are plenty of tusks in Bristleback Cave, south of Northshore Landing in Solstheim.

ingredients.name: Briar Heart
ingredients.location: Briar Hearts are dropped by Forsworn Briarhearts. Briarhearts can usually be found in Forsworn camps, such as Lost Valley Redoubt. There are also a couple of Briar Hearts in Gallows Rock.

ingredients.name: Honeycomb
ingredients.location: Honeycombs can be harvested from beehives. A good way to find beehives is looking out for bees flying around, as a beehive might be nearby. Several beehives can be found near Honeystrand cave, south of Ivarstead.

ingredients.name: Pearl
ingredients.location: Pearls are azure-blue triangle-shaped stones which cannot be salvaged anywhere. The only way to get Pearls is to find a sample, most of which are randomly placed in Skyrim. They can usually be found in Geirmund's Hall, east of Ivarstead, and very rarely in Apothecary's Satchels.

ingredients.name: Slaughterfish Scales
ingredients.location: Slaughterfish Scales are the silvery scales of the dreaded Slaughterfish, and can be looted from their bodies. Slaughterfish can be found in most types of water, but especially in lakes. Collecitons of scale samples can be found in Tolvald's Cave, northeast of Shor's Stone, or Glenmoril Coven, west of Falkreath.

ingredients.name: Tundra Cotton
ingredients.location: Tundra Cotton is a very common plant which has large white flowers that almost look like cotton balls (hence the name). The plant is very common in Whiterun Hold, with lots of samples available near Broken Fang Cave, west of Whiterun and Whitewatch Tower, northeast of Whiterun.

ingredients.name: Creep Cluster
ingredients.location: Creep Cluster are harvested from orange-colored roots growing on rocks. They're generally only found in Eastmarch, with a large collection found near Steamcrag Camp, south of Windhelm.

ingredients.name: Giant's Toe
ingredients.location: Giant's Toes are appendages dropped by all varieities of Giants. The best place to look for Giants are their camps, which are scattered around Skyrim. Giants can also be found individually or in groups around the wilderness, sometimes herding Mammoths. Samples of Giant's Toes can be found in The White Hall in Dawnstar, or in the East Empire Company Warehouse outside of Solitude.

ingredients.name: Hawk Beak
ingredients.location: Hawk Beaks are dropped by slain Hawks, which can be difficult to find and even more difficult to kill. There is a large collection of Hawks near the East Empire Company Warehouse outside of Solitude, and more just northeast of Solitude. There's also an individual Hawk Beak in Alftand, southeast of Winterhold.

ingredients.name: Netch Jelly
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Netch Jelly is a bluish substance inside a stone bowl. It is dropped by Netch, jellyfish-like creatures that can be found in groups of three to five near water in the southern regions of Solstheim. There are a couple of samples of jelly in Raven Rock Mine as well.

ingredients.name: Poison Bloom
ingredients.location: Added in the Dawnguard DLC, Poison Bloom is a purple flower which can only be found in Darkfall Cave, north of Markarth. If not immediately picked, it will release a poisonous gas when someone is near.

ingredients.name: River Betty
ingredients.location: River Betty is a purple fish that can be caught in lakes, ponds and rivers (despite the name, they're no more commonly found in rivers than any other fish). They're more commonly found in shallow water: a good spot to find them is in the water around The Apprentice Stone, west-northwest of Morthal. River Betty can also be found in fish barrels or sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Scaly Pholiota
ingredients.location: Scaly Pholiota is a light yellow fungus that grow on tree stumps and fallen trees. They're common in The Rift forests, with the areas around Darklight Tower, southwest of Riften, and Honeystrand Cave to the south of Ivarstead, being especially good for finding Scaly Pholiota.

ingredients.name: Trama Root
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Trama Root are dead-looking roots that can be harvested from spikey-looking plants growing in the ash-covered parts of Solstheim. There are a bunch of Trama Roots in Severin Manor in Raven Rock as well.

ingredients.name: Wisp Wrappings
ingredients.location: Wisp Wrappings look like long thin white film. They are dropped by Wispmothers, which are typically found in non-snowy wilderness. Peddlers randomly walking around in the wilderness also have a chance of carrying them.

ingredients.name: Ancestor Moth Wing
ingredients.location: Added in the Dawnguard DLC, Ancestor Moth Wings are wings that can be harvested from Ancestor Moths. These moths can be only found in Ancestor Glade, east of Falkreath along the southern border of Skyrim. Ancestor Moths cannot be harvested for their wings while they are flying, only when they have landed.

ingredients.name: Blue Butterfly Wing
ingredients.location: Blue Butterfly Wings can be harvested by catching blue butterflies. Butterflies can be found during the day in non-snowy areas. A large collection of butterflies exists near Talking Stone Giant Camp, northeast of Rorikstead along the Hjaal river.

ingredients.name: Blue Mountain Flower
ingredients.location: Blue Mountain Flowers are, as the name suggests, blue flowers. They look the same as purple and red mountain flowers, and can be found in large droves in the foothills and below the snowline in the mountains. A large collection of Blue Mountain Flowers can be found near Sleeping Tree Camp, southeast of Rorikstead, and they are frequently sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Bone Meal
ingredients.location: Bone Meal is dropped by undead, such as skeletons and draugr, both of which may drop a sample. They're always dropped by Dragon Priests and are frequently sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Chaurus Hunter Antennae
ingredients.location: Added in the Dawnguard DLC, Chaurus Hunter Antennae are dropped by Chaurus Hunters and Chaurus Hunter Fledglings. These insect-like creatures can, like normal Chaurus, be found in caves and dungeons all over Skyrim.

ingredients.name: Frost Salts
ingredients.location: Frost Salts are a wooden bowl with white-blue contents, and are typically dropped by Frost Atronachs and Frost Thralls. Unfortunately, summoned atronachs don't drop any salts, and finding non-summoned Frost Atronachs can be tricky. Mistveil Keep in Riften, and the Grave Concoctions shop in Falkreath, will have samples of Frost Salts as well.

ingredients.name: Hagraven Feathers
ingredients.location: Unlike their claws, Hagraven Feathers are always dropped by Hagravens. Hagravens can often be found in the company of Forsworn, or inside of groves and lairs in the wilderness. Samples of Hagraven Feathers can be found in Hag's End, which is accessible through Deepwood Redoubt west of Solitude, as well as Witchmist Grove, south of Windhelm.

ingredients.name: Lavender
ingredients.location: Lavender is a purple-colored herb that grows in large parts of Skyrim, but seem to be particularly common in Whiterun hold. Many samples exist in the city of Whiterun itself, and there are a lot Lavender around Chillwind Depths, south of Dragon Bridge, as well.

ingredients.name: Ash Creep Cluster
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Ash Creep Cluster is a yellow cluster similar in appearance (but not color) to the normal Creep Cluster. They can be found exclusively in Solstheim. There's one right outside of Bloodskal Barrow, accessible from Raven Rock Mine, and another one in Raven Rock Mine itself.

ingredients.name: Beehive Husk
ingredients.location: Beehive Husks are collected from beehives. Look out for bees flying around: a beehive might be close nearby. Several beehives can be found near Honeystrand cave, south of Ivarstead.

ingredients.name: Ectoplasm
ingredients.location: Ectoplasm are wooden bowls with grey-green contents. They're dropped by ghosts and other etheral undead, which can be found in various dungeons. There are also several samples of Ectoplasm in the Hall of Countenance in the College of Winterhold and in The Mortar and Pestle shop in Dawnstar.

ingredients.name: Glow Dust
ingredients.location: Glow Dust is easy to identify as wooden bowls with glowing contents. They are dropped by Wisps and Wispmothers, which are typically found in non-snowy wilderness. There are also samples of Glow Dust in the Shrine of Mehrunes Dagon, southeast of Morthal, or in Proudspire Manor in Solitude (if you've bought it).

ingredients.name: Glowing Mushroom
ingredients.location: Glowing Mushroom are fungus growing on cave walls which are easy to spot because of their glow. A large collection of Glowing Mushrooms can be found in Tolvald's Cave, northwest of Shor's Stone in the Rift.

ingredients.name: Nightshade
ingredients.location: Nightshade are purple flowers that normally grow around graveyards. Samples can be collected in Solitude, the Hall of the Dead in Falkreath and in Labyrinthian, a ruin southeast of Morthal.

ingredients.name: Wisp Wrappings
ingredients.location: Wisp Wrappings look like long thin white film. They are dropped by Wispmothers, which are typically found in non-snowy wilderness. Peddlers randomly walking around in the wilderness also have a chance of carrying them.

ingredients.name: Ancestor Moth Wing
ingredients.location: Added in the Dawnguard DLC, Ancestor Moth Wings are wings that can be harvested from Ancestor Moths. These moths can be only found in Ancestor Glade, east of Falkreath along the southern border of Skyrim. Ancestor Moths cannot be harvested for their wings while they are flying, only when they have landed.

ingredients.name: Blue Butterfly Wing
ingredients.location: Blue Butterfly Wings can be harvested by catching blue butterflies. Butterflies can be found during the day in non-snowy areas. A large collection of butterflies exists near Talking Stone Giant Camp, northeast of Rorikstead along the Hjaal river.

ingredients.name: Chaurus Hunter Antennae
ingredients.location: Added in the Dawnguard DLC, Chaurus Hunter Antennae are dropped by Chaurus Hunters and Chaurus Hunter Fledglings. These insect-like creatures can, like normal Chaurus, be found in caves and dungeons all over Skyrim.

ingredients.name: Hagraven Claw
ingredients.location: Hagraven Claws are sometimes dropped by Hagravens, unlike their feathers which always drop. Hagravens can often be found in the company of Forsworn, or inside of groves and lairs in the wilderness. Samples of Hagraven Claws can be found in Grave Concoctions in Falkreath, Hall of Countenance at the College of Winterhold or The White Hall in Dawnstar.

ingredients.name: Snowberries
ingredients.location: Snowberries are red berries that grow on the Snowberry bush. Snowberries can be found outdoors in the snowy areas of Skyrim, and are particularly prevalent in the surroundings of Bloodlet Throne, southwest of Helgen, Windward Ruins, southwest of Dawnstar and Driftshade Refuge, southeast of Dawnstar.

ingredients.name: Spawn Ash
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Spawn Ash is a grey substance in a tan bowl. It is normally dropped by Ash Spawn, which randomly spawn in ashy areas of Solstheim and can also be found in Raven Rock Temple and during the March of the Dead quest.

ingredients.name: Spriggan Sap
ingredients.location: Spriggan Sap is a green-blue substance in a small ceramic bowl. It can unfortunately not be harvested from Spriggans, which drop Taproots instead. Multiple samples of Spriggan Sap can be found in Proudspire Manor in Solitude, Honeyside in Riften, and the Hall of Countenance in the College of Winterhold.

ingredients.name: Bear Claws
ingredients.location: Bear claws are dropped by killed bears, which can be found in the Skryim wilderness or cave lairs.

ingredients.name: Blue Mountain Flower
ingredients.location: Blue Mountain Flowers are, as the name suggests, blue flowers. They look the same as purple and red mountain flowers, and can be found in large droves in the foothills and below the snowline in the mountains. A large collection of Blue Mountain Flowers can be found near Sleeping Tree Camp, southeast of Rorikstead, and they are frequently sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Boar Tusk
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Boar Tusks are long tusks dropped by Bristlebacks and the Rieklings that ride them. There are plenty of tusks in Bristleback Cave, south of Northshore Landing in Solstheim.

ingredients.name: Giant's Toe
ingredients.location: Giant's Toes are appendages dropped by all varieities of Giants. The best place to look for Giants are their camps, which are scattered around Skyrim. Giants can also be found individually or in groups around the wilderness, sometimes herding Mammoths. Samples of Giant's Toes can be found in The White Hall in Dawnstar, or in the East Empire Company Warehouse outside of Solitude.

ingredients.name: Glowing Mushroom
ingredients.location: Glowing Mushroom are fungus growing on cave walls which are easy to spot because of their glow. A large collection of Glowing Mushrooms can be found in Tolvald's Cave, northwest of Shor's Stone in the Rift.

ingredients.name: Hanging Moss
ingredients.location: Hanging Moss is a green-brown plant often found hanging off rocky ledges, trees or dungeon ceilings. It can be found everywhere in Skyrim, but seems to be more frequent in The Reach. The Solitude Catacombs, Dustman's Cairn, northwest of Whiterun, and Kolskeggr Mine, east of Markarth, all have large collections of Hanging Moss.

ingredients.name: Wheat
ingredients.location: Wheat are identified as large yellow bales. They're very common on farms, with large collections outside of Cowflop Farmhouse in Rorikstead and Hollyfrost Farm, east of Windhelm. They're also frequently sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Yellow Mountain Flower
ingredients.location: Added in the Dawnguard DLC, Yellow Mountain Flower look the same as blue, purple and red mountain flowers, but with yellow flowers instead. A really good spot for Yellow Mountain Flowers is in Ancestor Glade, east of Falkreath.

ingredients.name: Ice Wraith Teeth
ingredients.location: Ice Wraith Teeth are icy fangs dropped by Ice Wraith. Ice Wraiths can be found in the snowy parts of Skyrim, and also live in The Midden below the College of Winterhold. There are samples of Ice Wraith Teeth in Jorrvaskr in Whiterun as well as Hall of Attainment in the College of Winterhold.

ingredients.name: Sabre Cat Tooth
ingredients.location: Sabre Cats Teeth are sometimes dropped by Sabre Cats instead of eyes. Sabre Cats can be found everywhere in the wilderness, and occasionally samples of their teeth can be found on peddlers and Forsworn. A couple of eyes can also be found in Drelas' Cottage, which is located northwest of Dustman's Cairn and south of Morthal.

ingredients.name: Slaughterfish Scales
ingredients.location: Slaughterfish Scales are the silvery scales of the dreaded Slaughterfish, and can be looted from their bodies. Slaughterfish can be found in most types of water, but especially in lakes. Collecitons of scale samples can be found in Tolvald's Cave, northeast of Shor's Stone, or Glenmoril Coven, west of Falkreath.

ingredients.name: Thistle Branch
ingredients.location: Thistle Branch is harvested from Thistle plants, which are spiky-looking plants with purple flowers. Thistle plants are especially common in the southern pine forests, but can be found everywhere in low elevations. Large collections of Thistle Branches can be found around Riverwood, Falkreath and Pinewatch, northeast of Falkreath.

ingredients.name: White Cap
ingredients.location: White Cap are mushrooms with, as the name indicates, white caps. They're commonly found in caves. The largest source of Bleeding Crown is Chillwind Depths, a mountain cavern on the border of Hjaalmarch and The Reach.

ingredients.name: Dragon's Tongue
ingredients.location: Dragon's Tongue is a yellow flower. They are usually found in Eastmarch, with large collections around Steamcrag Camp, Witchmist Grove and Bonestrewn Crest, all of which can be found in close to each other south of Windhelm.

ingredients.name: Dwarven Oil
ingredients.location: Dwarven Oil is dropped by Dwarven Automatons, which can be found in dwarwen ruins. Dwarven centurions will always drop it, while other automatons such as spheres and spiders will drop it half of the time. Mzinchaleft, southwest of Dawnstar, is a good source of Dwarwen oil in particular.

ingredients.name: Mora Tapinella
ingredients.location: Mora Tapinella is a mushroom with white stem and yellow-brown caps that grow on tree stumps and fallen trees in the Skyrim forests. There is a lot of Mora Tapinella around Riverwood, as well as around Northwatch Keep, northwest of Dragon Bridge.

ingredients.name: Scaly Pholiota
ingredients.location: Scaly Pholiota is a light yellow fungus that grow on tree stumps and fallen trees. They're common in The Rift forests, with the areas around Darklight Tower, southwest of Riften, and Honeystrand Cave to the south of Ivarstead, being especially good for finding Scaly Pholiota.

ingredients.name: Taproot
ingredients.location: Taproot looks like a gnarled branch with a faint green glow. It is dropped by Spriggans, which can be found outdoors in the wilderness, as well as inside caves. Samples of Taproot can be found in Proudspire Manor in Solitude, Honeyside in Riften, as well as Nightcaller Temple in Dawnstar.

ingredients.name: Ash Hopper Jelly
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Ash Hopper Jelly is a red substance in an ornamented stone bowl. They are normally dropped by Ash Hoppers, which are found in southern Solstheim. There's one sample of the jelly downstairs in Severin Manor in Raven Rock.

ingredients.name: Beehive Husk
ingredients.location: Beehive Husks are collected from beehives. Look out for bees flying around: a beehive might be close nearby. Several beehives can be found near Honeystrand cave, south of Ivarstead.

ingredients.name: Felsaad Tern Feathers
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Felsaad Tern Feathers are feathers found on Felsaad Tern birds. The birds are likely to drop one to three feathers, and can be found anywhere in Solstheim but especially along Felsaad Coast. There are also feathers in Caerellius House in the Raven Rock docks and downstairs of Ienth Farm in Raven Rock.

ingredients.name: Hawk Feathers
ingredients.location: Hawk Feathers are dropped by Hawks, of which there is a large collection near the East Empire Company Warehouse outside of Solitude, and more just northeast of Solitude. There's also an individual Hawk Beak in Alftand, southeast of Winterhold, and Silver Hand members have a high chance of carrying them as well.

ingredients.name: Honeycomb
ingredients.location: Honeycombs can be harvested from beehives. A good way to find beehives is looking out for bees flying around, as a beehive might be nearby. Several beehives can be found near Honeystrand cave, south of Ivarstead.

ingredients.name: Luna Moth Wing
ingredients.location: Luna Moth Wings can be collected by Luna Moths, which are easy to spot thanks to their glowing wings. Unlike other butterflies, Luna Moths only come out at night, and there is a lot of them around Talking Stone Camp, northeast of Rorikstead as well as inside Bloated Man's Grotto, north of Falkreath.

ingredients.name: Skeever Tail
ingredients.location: Skeever Tails are dropped by Skeevers, and can also be found in any spider web sac that contains a Skeever. Skeevers are rat-like animals that can be found in caves and dungeons, as well as in the Skyrim wilderness. Additionally, a large cache of Skeever Tails can be found in the Commander's Quarters in Fort Dunstad, south of Dawnstar, as well as the Basement of Honningbrew Meadery just outside of Whiterun.

ingredients.name: Ashen Grass Pod
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Ashen Grass Pod is harvested from spiky grass plants all over Solstheim. There is a sample of the pods downstairs in Severin Manor in Raven Rock.

ingredients.name: Falmer Ear
ingredients.location: Falmer Ears are the actual ears of Falmers, and can be found on their bodies. Falmers can be found in underground lairs, often near Dwarven ruins. There are also a whole bunch of ears in the Alftand ruins, southwest of Winterhold, and in Forelhost, southeast of Riften.

ingredients.name: Namira's Rot
ingredients.location: Namira's Rot are mushrooms with brownish caps, which are commonly found on cave floors. The largest source of Namira's Rot is Chillwind Depths, a mountain cavern on the border of Hjaalmarch and The Reach.

ingredients.name: Pine Thrush Egg
ingredients.location: Pine Thrush Eggs are rust-colored eggs that can be harvested from bird nests. Both Pine Thrush Eggs and Rock Warbler Eggs come from similar-looking nests, but Pine Thrush Eggs are more common in forest areas. Around Heartwood Mill, west of Riften, there's a large collection of Pine Thrush nests.

ingredients.name: Spider Egg
ingredients.location: Spider Eggs are yellow-green eggs that can be harvested from egg and web sacs of Frostbite Spiders. Spiders are generally found in dungeons, where eggs are more likely to appear, but can also spawn in the wilderness. There's a lot of Spider Eggs in Harmugstahl, northeast of Markarth, and in Ironbind Barrow, inbetween Winterhold and Whiterun.

ingredients.name: Briar Heart
ingredients.location: Briar Hearts are dropped by Forsworn Briarhearts. Briarhearts can usually be found in Forsworn camps, such as Lost Valley Redoubt. There are also a couple of Briar Hearts in Gallows Rock.

ingredients.name: Ectoplasm
ingredients.location: Ectoplasm are wooden bowls with grey-green contents. They're dropped by ghosts and other etheral undead, which can be found in various dungeons. There are also several samples of Ectoplasm in the Hall of Countenance in the College of Winterhold and in The Mortar and Pestle shop in Dawnstar.

ingredients.name: Emperor Parasol Moss
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Emperor Parasol Moss are plants growing from Emperor Parasol mushrooms. The mushrooms can be found near Tel Mithryn in southeastern Solstheim.

ingredients.name: Histcarp
ingredients.location: Histcarp is a orange-colored fish that can be caught in lakes, ponds and rivers. A good spot to find them is in the water around The Apprentice Stone, west-northwest of Morthal. Histcarp can also be found in fish barrels or sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Jazbay Grapes
ingredients.location: Jazbay Grapes are blue-purple berries that can be harvested from the golden-colored Jazbay vines that grow in Eastmarch's rocky areas. A large number of Jazbay Grapes can be found near Steamcrag Camp and Witchmist Grove, both to the south of Windhelm.

ingredients.name: Red Mountain Flower
ingredients.location: Red Mountain Flowers are, as the name suggests, red flowers. They look the same as blue and purple mountain flowers, and can be found in large droves in the foothills and below the snowline in the mountains. A lot of Red Mountain Flowers can be found in Shadowgreen Cavern, north-northwest of Solitude. They are also frequently sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Salmon Roe
ingredients.location: Added in the Hearthfire DLC, Salmon Roe look like small orange pearls on a wooden plate. They can be found in player-built homes or by harvesting jumping salmon. The waterfalls of White River are an especially good place to find jumping salmon.

ingredients.name: Tundra Cotton
ingredients.location: Tundra Cotton is a very common plant which has large white flowers that almost look like cotton balls (hence the name). The plant is very common in Whiterun Hold, with lots of samples available near Broken Fang Cave, west of Whiterun and Whitewatch Tower, northeast of Whiterun.

ingredients.name: Void Salts
ingredients.location: Void Salts are a wooden bowl with dark grey contents, and are typically dropped by Storm Atronachs and Storm Thralls. Unfortunately, summoned atronachs don't drop any salts, and finding non-summoned Storm Atronachs can be tricky. The Blue Palace in Solitude, Angeline's Aromatics shop in Solitude, and Proudspire Manor in Solitude (if you've bought it) will have samples of Void Salts as well.

ingredients.name: Canis Root
ingredients.location: Canis Root is harvested from small gnarled bushes. They are usually found near near rock formations or the base of cliffs in the Rift, or in swampy regions in Hjaalmarch. The largest collection of Canis Roots can be found around Folgunthur, east of Solitude, or Pinepeak Cavern, north of Ivarstead.

ingredients.name: Elves Ear
ingredients.location: Despite the name, Elves Ears aren't actual ears, but rather a plant normally hanging to dry inside buildings. Good places to find them are Dragonsreach in Whiterun, Castle Dour in Solitude and Thalmor Embassy in Haafingar. They are also frequently sold by vendors.

ingredients.name: Juniper Berries
ingredients.location: Juniper Berries are small white berries that can be harvested from a tree-like bush that grow in The Reach. The surroundings around Dushnikh Yal and Valthume, southeast of Markarth, have a large density of Juniper Berries.

ingredients.name: Spider Egg
ingredients.location: Spider Eggs are yellow-green eggs that can be harvested from egg and web sacs of Frostbite Spiders. Spiders are generally found in dungeons, where eggs are more likely to appear, but can also spawn in the wilderness. There's a lot of Spider Eggs in Harmugstahl, northeast of Markarth, and in Ironbind Barrow, inbetween Winterhold and Whiterun.

ingredients.name: Bear Claws
ingredients.location: Bear claws are dropped by killed bears, which can be found in the Skryim wilderness or cave lairs.

ingredients.name: Canis Root
ingredients.location: Canis Root is harvested from small gnarled bushes. They are usually found near near rock formations or the base of cliffs in the Rift, or in swampy regions in Hjaalmarch. The largest collection of Canis Roots can be found around Folgunthur, east of Solitude, or Pinepeak Cavern, north of Ivarstead.

ingredients.name: Hanging Moss
ingredients.location: Hanging Moss is a green-brown plant often found hanging off rocky ledges, trees or dungeon ceilings. It can be found everywhere in Skyrim, but seems to be more frequent in The Reach. The Solitude Catacombs, Dustman's Cairn, northwest of Whiterun, and Kolskeggr Mine, east of Markarth, all have large collections of Hanging Moss.

ingredients.name: Hawk Feathers
ingredients.location: Hawk Feathers are dropped by Hawks, of which there is a large collection near the East Empire Company Warehouse outside of Solitude, and more just northeast of Solitude. There's also an individual Hawk Beak in Alftand, southeast of Winterhold, and Silver Hand members have a high chance of carrying them as well.

ingredients.name: Rock Warbler Egg
ingredients.location: Rock Warbler Eggs are green eggs found in bird nests. Both Rock Warbler Eggs and Pine Thrush Eggs come from similar-looking nests, but Rock Warbler Eggs are more common in rocky areas. A particularly good spot for Rock Warbler Eggs are the area around Valthume, southeast of Markarth.

ingredients.name: Small Pearl
ingredients.location: Small Pearls are azure-blue round stones which cannot be salvaged anywhere. The only way to get Small Pearls is to find a sample, most of which are randomly placed around Skyrim. They can usually be found in Geirmund's Hall, east of Ivarstead, as well as Alftand, southeast of Winterhold. Occassionally, Small Pearls are carried by Peddlers or are very rarely in Apothecary's Satchels.

ingredients.name: Blue Dartwing
ingredients.location: Blue Dartwings can be harvested by catching blue dragonflies. Dragonflies are normally found near water during the day. A large collection of dragonflies exists near The Apprentice Stone, on a island in the march west-northwest of Morthal.

ingredients.name: Nordic Barnacle
ingredients.location: Nordic Barnacle are found in nordic barnacle clusters, which are only found underwater. A good spot to find them is Hela's Folly, a shipwreck northeast of Dawnstar.

ingredients.name: Orange Dartwing
ingredients.location: Blue Dartwings can be harvested by catching orange dragonflies. Dragonflies are normally found near water during the day. A large collection of dragonflies exists near The Apprentice Stone, on a island in the marsh west-northwest of Morthal.

ingredients.name: Slaughterfish Egg
ingredients.location: Slaughterfish Eggs are yellow-green eggs which can only be found in underwater nests, and not on Slaughterfish themselves. There's a large collection of Slaughterfish Egg nests around the Wreck Of The Brinehammer, west of Dawnstar, as well as The Serpent Stone, east of Winterhold. There's also a bunch of samples lying around in the Arch-Mage's Quarters in the College of Winterhold.

ingredients.name: Abecean Longfin
ingredients.location: Abecean Longfin is a silvery fish that can be caught in lakes, ponds and rivers. A good way to find them is to look for dragonflies above the water: you can usually find a Longfin or two right beneath them. They can also be found in fish barrels or sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Cyrodilic Spadetail
ingredients.location: Cyrodilic Spadetail is a red fish that can be caught in lakes, ponds and rivers. They're more commonly found in shallow water: a good spot to find them is in the water around The Apprentice Stone, west-northwest of Morthal. Cyrodilic Spadetail can also be found in fish barrels or sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Salt Pile
ingredients.location: Salt Piles are wooden bowls with white contents. They are extremely common throughout Skyrim and can be found in buildings and dungeons alike. Alchemy vendors and innkeepers normally have several samples for sale. A large collection of Salt Piles can be found south of Merryfair Farm, northwest of Riften.

ingredients.name: Small Antlers
ingredients.location: Small Antlers are antlers dropped by female Elk, while males drop Large Antlers instead. Elks can be found around the Skyrim wilderness, and have a 50/50 chance of dropping antlers when killed. Peddlers sometimes carry antlers as well, and a couple of samples of Small Antlers can be found in Rimerock Burrow, northwest of Dragon Bridge.

ingredients.name: Small Pearl
ingredients.location: Small Pearls are azure-blue round stones which cannot be salvaged anywhere. The only way to get Small Pearls is to find a sample, most of which are randomly placed around Skyrim. They can usually be found in Geirmund's Hall, east of Ivarstead, as well as Alftand, southeast of Winterhold. Occassionally, Small Pearls are carried by Peddlers or are very rarely in Apothecary's Satchels.

ingredients.name: Yellow Mountain Flower
ingredients.location: Added in the Dawnguard DLC, Yellow Mountain Flower look the same as blue, purple and red mountain flowers, but with yellow flowers instead. A really good spot for Yellow Mountain Flowers is in Ancestor Glade, east of Falkreath.

ingredients.name: Blisterwort
ingredients.location: Blisterwort are red-capped mushrooms commonly found in caves. The largest source of Blisterwort is Chillwind Depths, a mountain cavern on the border of Hjaalmarch and The Reach.

ingredients.name: Glowing Mushroom
ingredients.location: Glowing Mushroom are fungus growing on cave walls which are easy to spot because of their glow. A large collection of Glowing Mushrooms can be found in Tolvald's Cave, northwest of Shor's Stone in the Rift.

ingredients.name: Sabre Cat Tooth
ingredients.location: Sabre Cats Teeth are sometimes dropped by Sabre Cats instead of eyes. Sabre Cats can be found everywhere in the wilderness, and occasionally samples of their teeth can be found on peddlers and Forsworn. A couple of eyes can also be found in Drelas' Cottage, which is located northwest of Dustman's Cairn and south of Morthal.

ingredients.name: Spriggan Sap
ingredients.location: Spriggan Sap is a green-blue substance in a small ceramic bowl. It can unfortunately not be harvested from Spriggans, which drop Taproots instead. Multiple samples of Spriggan Sap can be found in Proudspire Manor in Solitude, Honeyside in Riften, and the Hall of Countenance in the College of Winterhold.

ingredients.name: Abecean Longfin
ingredients.location: Abecean Longfin is a silvery fish that can be caught in lakes, ponds and rivers. A good way to find them is to look for dragonflies above the water: you can usually find a Longfin or two right beneath them. They can also be found in fish barrels or sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Ashen Grass Pod
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Ashen Grass Pod is harvested from spiky grass plants all over Solstheim. There is a sample of the pods downstairs in Severin Manor in Raven Rock.

ingredients.name: Beehive Husk
ingredients.location: Beehive Husks are collected from beehives. Look out for bees flying around: a beehive might be close nearby. Several beehives can be found near Honeystrand cave, south of Ivarstead.

ingredients.name: Frost Mirriam
ingredients.location: Frost Mirriam are dried plants found hanging in houses, often near garlic and elves ears. A couple of good examples of Frost Mirriam sources are Black-Briar Lodge east of Riften, Vlindrel Hall in Markarth and Burguk's Longhouse in Dushnikh Yal, east of Markarth.

ingredients.name: Hawk Feathers
ingredients.location: Hawk Feathers are dropped by Hawks, of which there is a large collection near the East Empire Company Warehouse outside of Solitude, and more just northeast of Solitude. There's also an individual Hawk Beak in Alftand, southeast of Winterhold, and Silver Hand members have a high chance of carrying them as well.

ingredients.name: Human Flesh
ingredients.location: As the name describes, Human Flesh is chunks of meat off a human body and looks a lot like raw beef. Unfortunately, the ingredient cannot be looted from humans, but are found in necromancer dungeons and in locations where people have performed the black sacrement ritual to summon the Dark Brotherhood. There's a large collection of Human Flesh in Castle Volkihar (Dawnguard only); otherwise, look in Alftand, southeast of Winterhold, or Tolvald's Cave, northeast of Shor's Stone.

ingredients.name: Powdered Mammoth Tusk
ingredients.location: Powdered Mammoth Tusks are bowls with yellowish contents. They can only be looted, and not made from mammoth tusks. Powdered Mammoth Tusks are very rare and there are no guaranteed samples; the best bet is finding peddlers randomly in the wilderness, in Apothecary's Satchels or dropped by Forsworn.

ingredients.name: Purple Mountain Flower
ingredients.location: Purple Mountain Flowers are, as the name suggests, purple flowers. They look the same as blue and red mountain flowers, and can be found in large droves in the foothills and below the snowline in the mountains. Plenty of Purple Mountain Flowers can be found around Pinewatch, west of Helgen, and they are frequently sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Boar Tusk
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Boar Tusks are long tusks dropped by Bristlebacks and the Rieklings that ride them. There are plenty of tusks in Bristleback Cave, south of Northshore Landing in Solstheim.

ingredients.name: Chaurus Eggs
ingredients.location: Charus Eggs can be found in Falmer hives, and they are also dropped by Chaurus and Chaurus Reapers. They are round and glow with a pale blue light, making them easy to spot even in caves. Frostflow Lighthouse, west of Winterhold, has a huge number of Chaurus Eggs.

ingredients.name: Garlic
ingredients.location: Garlic are normally found in houses, hanging from the ceiling in braids. The largest collections of garlic can be found in the Thalmor Embassy, north of Solitude in Haafingar, and in Boulderfall Cave, northwest of Riften. Garlic is frequently sold by vendors.

ingredients.name: Large Antlers
ingredients.location: Large Antlers are antlers dropped by male Deer, Elk or White Stag; females drop Small Antlers instead. Each of the animals can be found around the Skyrim wilderness, and have a 50/50 chance of dropping antlers when killed. Peddlers sometimes carry antlers as well; Vaermina Devotees in Nightcaller Temple have a very small chance of dropping them as well.

ingredients.name: Lavender
ingredients.location: Lavender is a purple-colored herb that grows in large parts of Skyrim, but seem to be particularly common in Whiterun hold. Many samples exist in the city of Whiterun itself, and there are a lot Lavender around Chillwind Depths, south of Dragon Bridge, as well.

ingredients.name: Slaughterfish Egg
ingredients.location: Slaughterfish Eggs are yellow-green eggs which can only be found in underwater nests, and not on Slaughterfish themselves. There's a large collection of Slaughterfish Egg nests around the Wreck Of The Brinehammer, west of Dawnstar, as well as The Serpent Stone, east of Winterhold. There's also a bunch of samples lying around in the Arch-Mage's Quarters in the College of Winterhold.

ingredients.name: Torchbug Thorax
ingredients.location: Torchbug Thorax can be harvested by catching torchbugs. Torchbug can be found at night in non-snowy areas: their illuminated bodies make them easy to spot. A large collection of torchbugs exists near Talking Stone Giant Camp, northeast of Rorikstead along the Hjaal river.

ingredients.name: Dragon's Tongue
ingredients.location: Dragon's Tongue is a yellow flower. They are usually found in Eastmarch, with large collections around Steamcrag Camp, Witchmist Grove and Bonestrewn Crest, all of which can be found in close to each other south of Windhelm.

ingredients.name: Emperor Parasol Moss
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Emperor Parasol Moss are plants growing from Emperor Parasol mushrooms. The mushrooms can be found near Tel Mithryn in southeastern Solstheim.

ingredients.name: Fly Amanita
ingredients.location: Fly Amanita are mushrooms easily identified by their with red caps. They're commonly found in caves, with the largest source of Fly Amanita being Pinemoon Cave, northwest of Dragon Bridge, and Geirmund's Hall, east of Ivarstead.

ingredients.name: Troll Fat
ingredients.location: Troll Fat are wooden bowls with white contents. They are dropped by trolls, which can be found everywhere in the Skyrim wilderness. Another fantastic source of Troll Fat is the East Empire Company Warehouse on the Solitude docks.

ingredients.name: Blisterwort
ingredients.location: Blisterwort are red-capped mushrooms commonly found in caves. The largest source of Blisterwort is Chillwind Depths, a mountain cavern on the border of Hjaalmarch and The Reach.

ingredients.name: Boar Tusk
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Boar Tusks are long tusks dropped by Bristlebacks and the Rieklings that ride them. There are plenty of tusks in Bristleback Cave, south of Northshore Landing in Solstheim.

ingredients.name: Falmer Ear
ingredients.location: Falmer Ears are the actual ears of Falmers, and can be found on their bodies. Falmers can be found in underground lairs, often near Dwarven ruins. There are also a whole bunch of ears in the Alftand ruins, southwest of Winterhold, and in Forelhost, southeast of Riften.

ingredients.name: Fly Amanita
ingredients.location: Fly Amanita are mushrooms easily identified by their with red caps. They're commonly found in caves, with the largest source of Fly Amanita being Pinemoon Cave, northwest of Dragon Bridge, and Geirmund's Hall, east of Ivarstead.

ingredients.name: Hagraven Feathers
ingredients.location: Unlike their claws, Hagraven Feathers are always dropped by Hagravens. Hagravens can often be found in the company of Forsworn, or inside of groves and lairs in the wilderness. Samples of Hagraven Feathers can be found in Hag's End, which is accessible through Deepwood Redoubt west of Solitude, as well as Witchmist Grove, south of Windhelm.

ingredients.name: Human Heart
ingredients.location: Human Hearts cannot be looted off dead humans, but are instead found where in locations where people have performed the black sacrement ritual to summon the Dark Brotherhood. Samples exist in the Aretino Residence in Windhelm, Black-Briar Manor in Riften, and Volunruud, southeast of Morthal

ingredients.name: Troll Fat
ingredients.location: Troll Fat are wooden bowls with white contents. They are dropped by trolls, which can be found everywhere in the Skyrim wilderness. Another fantastic source of Troll Fat is the East Empire Company Warehouse on the Solitude docks.

ingredients.name: Ash Creep Cluster
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Ash Creep Cluster is a yellow cluster similar in appearance (but not color) to the normal Creep Cluster. They can be found exclusively in Solstheim. There's one right outside of Bloodskal Barrow, accessible from Raven Rock Mine, and another one in Raven Rock Mine itself.

ingredients.name: Chaurus Eggs
ingredients.location: Charus Eggs can be found in Falmer hives, and they are also dropped by Chaurus and Chaurus Reapers. They are round and glow with a pale blue light, making them easy to spot even in caves. Frostflow Lighthouse, west of Winterhold, has a huge number of Chaurus Eggs.

ingredients.name: Crimson Nirnroot
ingredients.location: Crimson Nirnroot is a special type of Nirnroot found exclusively in Blackreach. Like normal Nirnroots, the crimson variant is usually found near water and makes a chiming sound when you get near it.

ingredients.name: Ice Wraith Teeth
ingredients.location: Ice Wraith Teeth are icy fangs dropped by Ice Wraith. Ice Wraiths can be found in the snowy parts of Skyrim, and also live in The Midden below the College of Winterhold. There are samples of Ice Wraith Teeth in Jorrvaskr in Whiterun as well as Hall of Attainment in the College of Winterhold.

ingredients.name: Luna Moth Wing
ingredients.location: Luna Moth Wings can be collected by Luna Moths, which are easy to spot thanks to their glowing wings. Unlike other butterflies, Luna Moths only come out at night, and there is a lot of them around Talking Stone Camp, northeast of Rorikstead as well as inside Bloated Man's Grotto, north of Falkreath.

ingredients.name: Nirnroot
ingredients.location: Nirnroot is a plant that glows in the dark and makes a chiming sound when you get near them. They're usually found near water, or at Sarethi Farm between Riften and Ivarstead, where they are being cultivated.

ingredients.name: Vampire Dust
ingredients.location: Vampire Dust is a dark grey substance inside a wooden bowl. They're always dropped by Vampires, which can be found in dark lairs and caves all around Skyrim, and sometimes in the wilderness as well. Nightcaller Temple outside of Dawnstar has a few samples of Vampire Dust, as do both The Mortar and Pestle shop inside of Dawnstar itself and Honeyside in Riften.

ingredients.name: Imp Stool
ingredients.location: Imp Stool are round mushrooms with yellowish caps, which are commonly found in caves. The largest source of Imp Stool is Chillwind Depths, a mountain cavern on the border of Hjaalmarch and The Reach.

ingredients.name: Mora Tapinella
ingredients.location: Mora Tapinella is a mushroom with white stem and yellow-brown caps that grow on tree stumps and fallen trees in the Skyrim forests. There is a lot of Mora Tapinella around Riverwood, as well as around Northwatch Keep, northwest of Dragon Bridge.

ingredients.name: Orange Dartwing
ingredients.location: Blue Dartwings can be harvested by catching orange dragonflies. Dragonflies are normally found near water during the day. A large collection of dragonflies exists near The Apprentice Stone, on a island in the marsh west-northwest of Morthal.

ingredients.name: Scathecraw
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Scathecraw are dark purple plants that can be harvested. The plant can be found in Solstheim areas covered in ash. There are many plants downstairs in Ienth Farm in Raven Rock.

ingredients.name: Slaughterfish Egg
ingredients.location: Slaughterfish Eggs are yellow-green eggs which can only be found in underwater nests, and not on Slaughterfish themselves. There's a large collection of Slaughterfish Egg nests around the Wreck Of The Brinehammer, west of Dawnstar, as well as The Serpent Stone, east of Winterhold. There's also a bunch of samples lying around in the Arch-Mage's Quarters in the College of Winterhold.

ingredients.name: Slaughterfish Scales
ingredients.location: Slaughterfish Scales are the silvery scales of the dreaded Slaughterfish, and can be looted from their bodies. Slaughterfish can be found in most types of water, but especially in lakes. Collecitons of scale samples can be found in Tolvald's Cave, northeast of Shor's Stone, or Glenmoril Coven, west of Falkreath.

ingredients.name: Hagraven Claw
ingredients.location: Hagraven Claws are sometimes dropped by Hagravens, unlike their feathers which always drop. Hagravens can often be found in the company of Forsworn, or inside of groves and lairs in the wilderness. Samples of Hagraven Claws can be found in Grave Concoctions in Falkreath, Hall of Countenance at the College of Winterhold or The White Hall in Dawnstar.

ingredients.name: Purple Mountain Flower
ingredients.location: Purple Mountain Flowers are, as the name suggests, purple flowers. They look the same as blue and red mountain flowers, and can be found in large droves in the foothills and below the snowline in the mountains. Plenty of Purple Mountain Flowers can be found around Pinewatch, west of Helgen, and they are frequently sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Swamp Fungal Pod
ingredients.location: Swamp Fungal Pods are white globe-shaped fungus growing in the marshes of Hjaalmarch. Areas with large collections of Swamp Fungal Pods are Movarth's Lair, north of Morthal, and The Apprentice Stone, northwest of Morthal, as well as around Morthal itself.

ingredients.name: Torchbug Thorax
ingredients.location: Torchbug Thorax can be harvested by catching torchbugs. Torchbug can be found at night in non-snowy areas: their illuminated bodies make them easy to spot. A large collection of torchbugs exists near Talking Stone Giant Camp, northeast of Rorikstead along the Hjaal river.

ingredients.name: Wheat
ingredients.location: Wheat are identified as large yellow bales. They're very common on farms, with large collections outside of Cowflop Farmhouse in Rorikstead and Hollyfrost Farm, east of Windhelm. They're also frequently sold by alchemy vendors.

ingredients.name: Butterfly Wing
ingredients.location: Blue Butterfly Wings can be harvested by catching orange monarch butterflies. Butterflies can be found during the day in non-snowy areas. A large collection of butterflies exists near Talking Stone Giant Camp, northeast of Rorikstead along the Hjaal river.

ingredients.name: Chicken's Egg
ingredients.location: Chicken's Eggs can be found in chicken nests around farms. Nests are usually under a low sloping roof, but can sometimes just be found on the ground. There's a large number of Chicken's Eggs in the Thalmor Embassy in Haafingar.

ingredients.name: Hawk's Egg
ingredients.location: Added in the Hearthfire DLC, Hawk's Eggs are white eggs that can be found in hawk nests. Such nests can be found on the roof of Heljarchen Hall and Lakeview Manor.

ingredients.name: Nightshade
ingredients.location: Nightshade are purple flowers that normally grow around graveyards. Samples can be collected in Solitude, the Hall of the Dead in Falkreath and in Labyrinthian, a ruin southeast of Morthal.

ingredients.name: Small Antlers
ingredients.location: Small Antlers are antlers dropped by female Elk, while males drop Large Antlers instead. Elks can be found around the Skyrim wilderness, and have a 50/50 chance of dropping antlers when killed. Peddlers sometimes carry antlers as well, and a couple of samples of Small Antlers can be found in Rimerock Burrow, northwest of Dragon Bridge.

ingredients.name: Briar Heart
ingredients.location: Briar Hearts are dropped by Forsworn Briarhearts. Briarhearts can usually be found in Forsworn camps, such as Lost Valley Redoubt. There are also a couple of Briar Hearts in Gallows Rock.

ingredients.name: Canis Root
ingredients.location: Canis Root is harvested from small gnarled bushes. They are usually found near near rock formations or the base of cliffs in the Rift, or in swampy regions in Hjaalmarch. The largest collection of Canis Roots can be found around Folgunthur, east of Solitude, or Pinepeak Cavern, north of Ivarstead.

ingredients.name: Gleamblossom
ingredients.location: Added in the Dawnguard DLC, Gleamblossom is a purple and blue flower. They can be found in caves and other dark places; there are especially large collection of Gleamblossom in Darkfall Passage and Forgotten Vale, both of which can be accessed through Darkfall Cave, north of Markarth.

ingredients.name: Human Flesh
ingredients.location: As the name describes, Human Flesh is chunks of meat off a human body and looks a lot like raw beef. Unfortunately, the ingredient cannot be looted from humans, but are found in necromancer dungeons and in locations where people have performed the black sacrement ritual to summon the Dark Brotherhood. There's a large collection of Human Flesh in Castle Volkihar (Dawnguard only); otherwise, look in Alftand, southeast of Winterhold, or Tolvald's Cave, northeast of Shor's Stone.

ingredients.name: Imp Stool
ingredients.location: Imp Stool are round mushrooms with yellowish caps, which are commonly found in caves. The largest source of Imp Stool is Chillwind Depths, a mountain cavern on the border of Hjaalmarch and The Reach.

ingredients.name: Netch Jelly
ingredients.location: Added in the Dragonborn DLC, Netch Jelly is a bluish substance inside a stone bowl. It is dropped by Netch, jellyfish-like creatures that can be found in groups of three to five near water in the southern regions of Solstheim.
